      • login

        public boolean login(String userId,
                     String userPassword)
              throws org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException,
                     org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException
        TODO: Save Login data, if keepUserLoggedIn set to true Perform a login for a given userId and password.
        Parameters:
        userId - Identifier of the user
        userPassword - Password of the user
        Returns:
        Returns Returns an TicketAuthenticatorWrapperWrapper containing both the ClientServerTicket and Authenticator
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException - If the entered clientId could not be found.
        org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException - In case of a communication error between client and server.

      • login

        public boolean login(String clientId)
              throws org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException,
                     org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException
        Perform a login for a given clientId.
        Parameters:
        clientId - Identifier of the user
        Returns:
        Returns Returns an TicketAuthenticatorWrapperWrapper containing both the ClientServerTicket and Authenticator
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException - If the entered clientId could not be found.
        org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException - In case of a communication error between client and server.

      • relog

        public boolean relog()
              throws org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException,
                     org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException
        Perform a relog for the client registered in the credentialStore.
        Returns:
        Returns true if relog successful, appropriate exception otherwise
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.NotAvailableException - If the entered clientId could not be found. Or if the clientId was not set in the beginning.
        org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException - In case of a communication error between client and server.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Logs a user out by setting CST and session key to null

      • completeLogout

        public void completeLogout()
        This method performs a complete logout by also clearing the previous client id. If the normal logout is used and a new user logs in he will be logged in at the last client every time. This method is mostly necessary for unit tests.

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        determines if a user is logged in. does not validate ClientServerTicket and SessionKey
        Returns:
        Returns true if logged in otherwise false

      • isAdmin

        public boolean isAdmin()
        Determines whether the currently logged in user is an admin.
        Returns:
        True if the user is an admin, false if not.

      • canUserLoginAgain

        public boolean canUserLoginAgain()
        determines if a user can login again.
        Returns:
        true if so, false otherwise

      • canClientLoginAgain

        public boolean canClientLoginAgain()
        determines if a client can login again.
        Returns:
        true if so, false otherwise

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated()
                        throws org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException
        determines if a user is authenticated. does validate ClientServerTicket and SessionKey
        Returns:
        Returns true if authenticated otherwise appropriate exception
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException - In case of a communication error between client and server.

      • changeCredentials

        public void changeCredentials(String clientId,
                              String oldCredentials,
                              String newCredentials)
                       throws org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException
        Changes the login credentials for a given user.
        Parameters:
        clientId - ID of the user / client whose credentials should be changed.
        oldCredentials - Old credentials, needed for verification.
        newCredentials - New credentials to be set.
        Throws:
        org.openbase.jul.exception.CouldNotPerformException - In case of a communication error between client and server.

      • registerClient

        Registers a client.
        Parameters:
        clientId - the id of the client
        Throws:

        Parameters:
        userId - the id of the user
        password - the password of the user
        isAdmin - flag if user should be an administrator

      • getUserAtClientId

        public String getUserAtClientId()
        If a user and/or client is logged in, this returns the concatenation of both IDs.
        Returns:
        userId@clientId
